Library.name: MaterialNavigationDrawer
Library.content: Navigation Drawer Activity with material design style and simplified methods

Library.name: RippleEffect
Library.content: ExpandableLayout provides an easy way to create a view called header with an expandable view. Both view are external layout to allow a maximum of customization.

Library.name: snackbar
Library.content: SnackBar messages for Android Applications.Snackbars provide lightweight feedback about an operation. They show a brief message at the bottom of the screen.

Library.name: Litepal
Library.content: LitePal is an Open Source Android library using object-relational mapping (ORM) pattern that allows developers to use SQLite database extremely easy. You can finish most of the database operations without writing even a SQL statement, including create or upgrade tables, crud operations, aggregate functions, etc. The setup of LitePal is quite simple as well, you can integrate it into your project in less than 5 minutes.

Library.name: Jsoup
Library.content: Jsoup is a Java library for working with real-world HTML. It provides a very convenient API for extracting and manipulating data, using the best of DOM, CSS, and jquery-like methods.

Library.name: ObservableScrollView
Library.content: Android library to observe scroll events on scrollable views.It's easy to interact with the Toolbar introduced in Android 5.0 Lollipop and may be helpful to implement look and feel of Material Design apps.

Library.name: CircleImageView
Library.content: A fast circular ImageView perfect for profile images. This is based on RoundedImageView from Vince Mi which itself is based on techniques recommended by Romain Guy.

Library.name: FloatingActionButton
Library.content: Floating action buttons are used for a promoted action. They are distinguished by a circled icon floating above the UI and have motion behaviors that include morphing, launching, and a transferring anchor point.Android floating action button which reacts on scrolling events. Becomes visible when an attached target is scrolled up and invisible when scrolled down.
